thread.title: Idaho ties in the NFL (2015 Week 7): Wilson has his best game with Saints
thread.title_full: Idaho ties in the NFL (2015 Week 7): Wilson has his best game with Saints

title: Idaho ties in the NFL (2015 Week 7): Wilson has his best game with Saints
text:
Order a reprint of this story 
Washington Redskins defensive back Jeron Johnson (20) waits for his introduction before an NFL football game against the Tampa Bay Buccaneers in Landover, Md., Sunday, Oct. 25, 2015. PATRICK SEMANSKY — The Associated Press 
Here are the results of NFL players from Idaho colleges and high schools during Week 7 of the 2015 NFL season: 
SUNDAY 
• New Orleans CB Kyle Wilson (No. 24, Boise State) started and had an interception on the final defensive play of the first half, a fumble recovery on a kickoff, a pass breakup and two tackles at Indianapolis. TE Josh Hill (No. 89, Blackfoot High/Idaho State) started, was targeted once and recovered a teammate’s fumble. He had a touchdown reception nullified by a pass interference penalty. Colts DT Billy Winn (No. 99, Boise State) had five tackles. RG Hugh Thornton (No. 69, Mountain View High) started and made the tackle on Wilson’s interception. 
• Tampa Bay RB Doug Martin (No. 22, Boise State) started and had 19 carries for 136 yards, along with three catches for 35 yards, at Washington. Redskins S Jeron Johnson (No. 20, Boise State) had one tackle. 
• Miami CB Jamar Taylor (No. 22, Boise State) started, made seven tackles (six solo) and broke up a pass against Houston. 
• Carolina DE Jared Allen (No. 69, Idaho State) started and had five tackles against Philadelphia, including a sack. He had two QB hits and defended a pass. 
• Dallas DT Tyrone Crawford (No. 98, Boise State) started and had three tackles at the New York Giants. DE DeMarcus Lawrence (No. 90, Boise State) started and made one tackle. 
• Oakland DE Benson Mayowa (No. 95, Idaho) made two tackles at San Diego.
